title: Celebrating Chile’s Independence Day
caption: Celebrating Chile’s Independence Day
desc: That’s the Villarrica volcano providing fireworks for our observance of Chile’s Independence Day celebrations - called Fiestas Patrias - taking place on September 18 and 19. The second-most active volcano in South America, Villarrica is known to the indigenous Mapuche people as Rucapillán (Devil’s House). This photo was taken on September 2, 2018, alarming nearby residents, but it wasn’t nearly as destructive as other relatively recent eruptions, like one in 2015 that prompted authorities to evacuate thousands of people.
